urls.title: Flooding: planning, managing and recovering from a flood
urls.description: Making a personal flood plan; what to do if a flood is forecast; what to do if a flood happens; cleaning up after a flood.

tweets.text:
Flood alerts have been sounded – keep up to date with weather forecasts @MetOffice and advice from the @EnvAgencyNW 

Take regular medicines? Keep them close at hand in case you have to leave quickly See @PHE_uk advice here https://t.co/uYa7NYyyp6 #flooding https://t.co/82bGi6gpy9

tweets.text:
There are  a number of #flood warnings and alerts in place this evening across the #northwest 
Check your local risk ➡️ https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/OMYNl6xDy3

An @EnvAgencyYNE flood warning is in force for Walsden Water. River levels across the Upper River Calder have risen and are now approaching levels where we expect properties to flood. Please take care and be prepared. Visit https://t.co/SOPqHGairw for advice. https://t.co/Xa21H6xf44
🌨 There is an amber flood alert for rain and possible flooding in certain areas of Newark and Sherwood. This alert has been issued by the @EnvAgency affecting the River Maun and the River Trent.

Just getting updated from @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria and #Lancashire incident team and we are getting important gaps in the rain from #StormChristoph that allows rivers to recover, particularly where we have had heavy showers #wigton https://t.co/bvPGP7DSsQ

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Springwatch
entity.description: Following the fortunes of a cast of unforgettable wildlife characters at the climax of spring.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

domain.name: TV Episodes
domain.description: Television show episodes

tweets.text:
🎥 WATCH: Preparations are underway as Greater #Manchester is set to be hit by #StormChristoph.

Our reporter @EloiseLinford is in #Salford speaking to @EnvAgency: https://t.co/GYo4lEEZ3Y

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been in #Croston where we have been operating one of our flood storage basins.

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ohmPMGkd1L

My latest stop today was at #Croston #Lancashire where I found Amber & Lynn from @EnvAgencyNW field teams overseeing the operation of our #flood storage basin. #incidents #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Ap9yeq1xTW

@austincwb @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Argghh. This is exactly what we should not do. We need to slow the flow to stop upland rain ending up in downstream shops, offices and homes. So - keep those gullies clogged up, reduce the flood peak and avoid misery to hundreds of homeowners and businesses.
With water levels rising and Storm Christoph on the way, we have been advised by @EnvAgencyMids will be deploying the flood barriers on the Wharfage in Ironbridge from 8am tomorrow #floodaware

#DoYouKnow what to do in flood? 

#StormChristoph will bring widespread flood alerts and warnings across the North West over the next few days. 

Check your flood risk here ➡️ https://t.co/ZAITy41Ta6 https://t.co/GMyAQDBuRU

#TeamEA is out prepping for the further #rainfall heading out way. We’re checking our #flood risk assets, clearing debris washed down by previous #rain & putting up defences in #Bewdley & #Shrewsbury.

If you see our folk please keep your distance & help them stay #CovidSafe. https://t.co/yR7V6fnVvF

tweets.text:
Stay safe at home - if you need to go outside, be alert to the dangers of flood water.

🌧 Never enter flood water, on foot or in a vehicle.
📱 Sign up to @EnvAgencyNW flood alerts.
📞 Call 999 if life is at risk - we’re here to help. #NotJustFires https://t.co/a4GF86dYu2

tweets.text: Ahead of heavy rainfall expected on Tuesday and Wednesday due to Storm Christoph, JBA's @floodforesight is forecasting the potential for flooding across northern England, coinciding with @metoffice and @EnvAgency warnings. We'll continue to monitor the event as it unfolds. https://t.co/5poKvPBnKZ

Over the coming days heavy rain is forecast for Yorkshire and the North East as #StormChristoph hits the region.  To sign up for flood alerts please visit the @EnvAgency website https://t.co/08qhBLjngI people can also call our Incident Hotline on 0800 80 70 60 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/z5e85DblaG

Funny going’s on today the black stuff started coming in and it wasn’t Guinness.  Spoke to @EnvAgency who were a great help.  We think it’s just a sediment pocket upstream but will monitor.  #whitleybay #cullercoats #monkseaton https://t.co/1B3rnVdqS5

tweets.text: @Henry_Ward91 @EnvAgency @NRobinsonEA @EnvAgencyMids @simonfisherNFU What does sheeting mean Henry?

Heavy rain is forecast overnight and the risk of flooding remains across South #Yorkshire. 

Thank you to our emergency services, @EnvAgencyYNE, @YorkshireWater and our local council's who are working round the clock to keep us safe.

Today @JamesBevanEA told us that #StormChristoph is set to bring expecting 'heavy and prolonged' rainfall onto saturated ground, posing risks of flooding to a 'substantial number' of properties and communities.

He lays out the steps that @EnvAgency are taking here 👇 https://t.co/NLEokNjBNx

I am always the first to criticise the @EnvAgency but they have been fantastic the last 48hrs. Good comms and on banks sheeting and hopefully sandbagging! Thank You! @NRobinsonEA @EnvAgencyMids @simonfisherNFU

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: .@EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA tells @CommonsEFRA that #StormChristoph brings 24 to 48 hours of heavy rain to ground that is already saturated. #TeamEA on the ground working with partners to prepare. Check your flood risk here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY https://t.co/DD7vHRRfXh

@AndreasHeinem @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Yes we do - EMBER project that @UniversityLeeds ran through @wateratleeds for example. Saturated peatlands have rougher surfaces that slow down flow. (And its not just peatland burning that is an issue - we burn heaths, grasses etc.)

Monksleaze was closed early this morning, the Sowy has returned to its normal winter level. We will be allowing the KSD level to fall substantially overnight to allow for some new flow monitoring equipment to be installed before the next band of rain comes in. #KSD  @EnvAgencySW

Heavy rainfall associated with Storm Christoph will be affecting North Wales and Shropshire over the next few days. This may result in Flood Alerts and Warnings being issued by @EnvAgencyMids . Keep an eye on the Environment Agency website: https://t.co/qme3ouRPBp

Our session with the @EnvAgency’s Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd and Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA has started – watch live NOW 👇

Making a journey this week? Please do not drive through #flood water. Check your route before you travel: https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine. #StormChristoph  #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/di6rCwoPtZ
